docwise_example.Findings: There are multiple areas of consolidation in the right upper lobe, right middle lobe and right lower lobe. These appear to be associated with a right-sided pleural effusion.
docwise_example.Impression: Pneumonia of the right lung with right-sided pleural effusion.
docwise_example.Technique: CT scan of the chest was performed with intravenous contrast administration.

docwise_example.Findings: There is a fracture of the radius, just proximal to the wrist joint.
docwise_example.Impression: Fracture of the radius, just proximal to the wrist joint.
docwise_example.Technique: X-ray of the right forearm was performed in the anteroposterior and lateral views.

docwise_example.Prognosis: The prognosis for diabetes mellitus is variable and depends on many factors, including the severity of the disease, the patient's overall health, and the effectiveness of treatment. With proper management, people with diabetes can live long and healthy lives. However, if diabetes is not managed effectively, it can lead to serious complications, such as heart disease, stroke, kidney failure, and blindness. The prognosis for OAB is also variable and depends on the severity of the condition, the patient's overall health, and the effectiveness of treatment. With proper management, people with OAB can live normal lives. However, if OAB is not managed effectively, it can lead to social isolation and embarrassment.

The prognosis for ischemic heart disease is variable and depends on many factors, including the severity of the disease, the patient's overall health, and the effectiveness of treatment. With proper management, people with ischemic heart disease can live long and healthy lives. However, if ischemic heart disease is not managed effectively, it can lead to serious complications, such as heart attack, stroke, and heart failure. The prognosis for previous PTCA is generally good. With proper management, people who have had a PTCA can live long and healthy lives. However, there is a risk of complications, such as restenosis (narrowing of the artery), bleeding, and blood clots.

summary_example.Summary: A 70-year-old male patient presented with urinary frequency, urgency, and urgency urinary incontinence. He was diagnosed with overactive bladder (OAB) and diabetes mellitus. He is currently taking Mirabegron for OAB but it has been ineffective. He also has controlled diabetes for 8 years and is on oral hypoglycemic agents. The patient was prescribed Vesigard, Megatas, and Looz for the treatment of OAB and constipation. The patient was also advised to follow up after 3 weeks with a bladder diary and to continue good control of his diabetes. A 63-year-old male patient presented with asymptomatic ischemic heart disease and previous percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). He was prescribed Cardivas for the treatment of ischemic heart disease. He was also advised to stop taking Concor and to continue other medications. The patient was advised to follow up after 3 months.

TreatmentDetails.TreatmentDescription: CT Scan of the chest is a medical imaging test that uses X-rays to create detailed images of the lungs, heart, and other organs in the chest. It is often used to diagnose pneumonia, lung cancer, and other conditions.
An X-ray of the right forearm is a medical imaging test that uses X-rays to create images of the bones in the right forearm. It is often used to diagnose fractures, sprains, and other conditions.
Vesigard is a medication used to treat overactive bladder (OAB). It helps to relax the muscles in the bladder, which can reduce the frequency and urgency of urination.
Megatas is a medication used to treat constipation. It helps to soften the stool and make it easier to pass.
Looz is a medication used to treat constipation. It helps to soften the stool and make it easier to pass.
Cardivas is a medication used to treat heart disease. It helps to relax the blood vessels and improve blood flow to the heart.
